    • Method Detail

      • changeLayer

        public void changeLayer(boolean toRMI,
                        int reqPort,
                        int objPort)
        Starts the operations needed to change layer
        Parameters:
        toRMI - flag to choose socket/RMI
        reqPort - request port to use or RMI port
        objPort - object port to use, not used if RMI

      • pushOutObj

        public void pushOutObj(java.io.Serializable obj)
        Pushes an object in the outbound queue
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to send

      • pushOutReq

        public void pushOutReq(AbsReq req)
        Pushes a request in the outbound queue
        Parameters:
        req - the request to send

      • sendOutObj

        public void sendOutObj()
                throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Pops and sends an object to the server from the outbound queue, blocks until confirmation has been received
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if this method is interrupted while waiting

      • sendOutReq

        public void sendOutReq()
                throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Pops and sends a request to the server from the outbound queue, blocks until confirmation has been received
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if this method is interrupted while waiting

      • login

        public java.lang.String login(java.lang.String host,
                              int requestPort,
                              int objectPort,
                              boolean isRecovery,
                              java.lang.String usn,
                              java.lang.String pw,
                              boolean newUser,
                              boolean useRMI,
                              CommUtilizer utilizer)
        Attempts a login with the given parameters
        Parameters:
        host - hostname to connect to
        requestPort - port for the request socket or RMI connection
        objectPort - port for the object socket, unused if RMI
        isRecovery - flag to indicate that this is a login recovery attempt
        usn - username
        pw - password
        newUser - flag to indicate that this is a registration attempt
        useRMI - flag to use rmi instead of socket
        utilizer - object that will handle the events
        Returns:
        null if no errors were raised, a textual representation of the error otherwise

      • getLastSeen

        public java.time.Instant getLastSeen()
        Returns the last seen timestamp
        Returns:
        the last seen timestamp

      • beginDisconnectedRoutines

        public boolean beginDisconnectedRoutines()
        Disconnects the comm layer
        Returns:
        true if no errors were raised

      • purgeComm

        public void purgeComm()
        Purges the comm layer

        public java.lang.String getHost()

        Returns:
        the current hostname

        public void stop()
        Stops the current listeners/handlers
